definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: I ride, they call it Muni, but it's the bus system here.
sentences.chinese: 我乘坐这里人所称的有轨电车。

sentences.english: Trams, or electric streetcars, were first introduced in New Zealand in 1905.
sentences.chinese: 有轨电车又叫电车，于1905年被首次引进新西兰。

sentences.english: What can you see from a tram or a double-decker?
sentences.chinese: 从有轨电车和双层电车上你能看到什么？

sentences.english: A similar situation also prevailed in its tram service.
sentences.chinese: 它的有轨电车系统也是相似的情况。

sentences.english: He caught the streetcar to his home in Bronx .
sentences.chinese: 他搭上了去布郎克斯他家的有轨电车。

sentences.english: The history of Hong Kong trams must be very old.
sentences.chinese: 这有轨电车的历史不短吧。

sentences.english: Have you been on a tram yet?
The streetcar passed one stop after another.
sentences.chinese: 有轨电车开过一站又一站。

sentences.english: He took a northbound trolley on State Street.
sentences.chinese: 他在州街登上了一辆北行的有轨电车。

sentences.english: The trams clanged their way along the streets.
sentences.chinese: 有轨电车哐啷哐啷沿街驶过。

sentences.english: And she wants me to walk with her as far as the tram.
sentences.chinese: 她想让我陪她走到有轨电车那儿。

sentences.english: Tramcars run through the streets of the city.
sentences.chinese: 有轨电车行驶于这座城市的大街上。

sentences.english: Coaches were numerous, pedestrians many, and in Fifty-ninth Street the street cars were crowded.
sentences.chinese: 到处都是马车和行人，五十九街的有轨电车十分拥挤。

sentences.english: Come on, walk with me a bit, till the tram.
sentences.chinese: 来吧，和我一起走一段，到有轨电车那儿。

sentences.english: He went across Fourteenth Street on the car and got a transfer south on Broadway.
sentences.chinese: 他乘有轨电车穿过十四街，在百老汇大街转车朝南。

sentences.english: Streetcar is a must-ride in London.

definition: light rail/transit system (underground, at street level or elevated)/streetcar/metro/abbr. for 輕型軌道交通|轻型轨道交通[qing1 xing2 gui3 dao4 jiao1 tong1]
public transportation/mass transit/abbr. for 公共交通[gong1 gong4 jiao1 tong1]
to change train (plane, bus etc)/transfer between modes of transport
(coll.) tram, especially Beijing trams during period of operation 1924-1956/also written 噹噹車|当当车[dang1 dang1 che1]
to open to traffic (e.g. new bridge, rail line etc)/(of a locality) to have a transportation service/(Tw) to commute
